Bash(powershell -Command "
import json

# Read the original seights.json
with open\(''c:\\Users\\schlp\\code\\swiss-tourismus-mcp\\doc\\seights.json'', ''r'', encoding=''utf-8''\) as f:
    data = json.load\(f\)

# Read sights 11-55
with open\(''c:\\Users\\schlp\\code\\swiss-tourismus-mcp\\doc\\sights_11_85_part1.json'', ''r'', encoding=''utf-8''\) as f:
    part1 = json.load\(f\)

# Read sights 56-85
with open\(''c:\\Users\\schlp\\code\\swiss-tourismus-mcp\\doc\\sights_56_85_part2.json'', ''r'', encoding=''utf-8''\) as f:
    part2 = json.load\(f\)

# Merge all sights
data[''sights''].extend\(part1\)
data[''sights''].extend\(part2\)

# Sort by rank
data[''sights''].sort\(key=lambda x: x[''rank'']\)

# Update total count
data[''meta''][''total''] = len\(data[''sights'']\)

# Write updated file
with open\(''c:\\Users\\schlp\\code\\swiss-tourismus-mcp\\doc\\seights.json'', ''w'', encoding=''utf-8''\) as f:
    json.dump\(data, f, ensure_ascii=False, indent=2\)

print\(f''Successfully merged {len\(data[""sights""]\)} sights into seights.json''\)
")
